elements.title: Ryu Sung-hyun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympian Ryu Sung-hyun (pictured) taught himself gymnastics for four years because his father did not want him to become an athlete?

elements.title: metaphysics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a nihilist school of metaphysics contends that tables and chairs do not exist?

elements.title: Cora Babbitt Johnson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the efforts of Cora Babbitt Johnson helped delay the construction of Mount Rushmore until 1927?

elements.title: Sea of Voices (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Sea of Voices" was well-received by Porter Robinson's fans even though it was a fundamental change from his prior musical style?

elements.title: Morris Villarroel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Morris Villarroel wore a camera on his chest that took around 1,200 photographs per day for several years?

elements.title: 11-year history (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Seattle Reign FC have had three name changes during their 11-year history?

elements.title: Battle of Stainmore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eric Bloodaxe's death at the Battle of Stainmore ended the independence of Scandinavian York?

elements.title: Ella Scoble Opperman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the legacy of American pianist Ella Scoble Opperman has been said to continue "to entertain and draw attention to Tallahassee" decades after her death?

elements.title: Kekerengu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the sheep-farming founder of Kekerengu in New Zealand became an international fugitive?
